entry.title: 404 not found error using the BTP destination service in SAP Business Application Studio
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have created a multitarget application in which I have added the standalone app router and Basic Fiori Application.

I am using the xs-app JSON file in a Fiori application with the below getToken Destination Details.

I am utilising the destination details from xs-app.json in our controller.

when we are running our UI5 Application, we are getting a 404 Not Found response.

I still do not know the cause of the error. let me know what is the cause of the error and how to solve it?

entry.title: SAP CAP : 502 "Error during request to remote service: read ECONNRESET"
entry.content:
Hi,

I am developing SAP CAP application, node.js, trying to connect to external S4 onPrem service which is accessed via the cloud connector.

I am trying to reach S4 OData service from CAP Application locally in Business Application Studio via SAP Cloud Connector.

To connect to the destination and other services we are using the “cds bind -2” command, which created the .cdsrc-private.json file.

I am able to connect to the different BTP instances like the destination, authorization and connectivity instances, when i run the app using 

cds watch --profile hybrid

But when i'm trying to access any of the entities within the S4 OData service facing the following error,

{"error":{"code":"502","message":"Error during request to remote service: read ECONNRESET"}}

Has anyone faced this issue, please suggest an appropriate solution for this.

Also when the applicaiton is deployed to BTP,  the S4 odata services are accessiable via destination and the application is working as expected,

i want run the application locally for development phase, hence need your help,

Regards,

Aakash

entry.title: Delay data loading of SAP Macros table until button click? - UI5
entry.content:
Hi all - Wanted to know if its possible to delay loading of data from a macros table within a XML fragment? Currently, when you click on a list page record -> open object page -> my macros table in a custom section renders, and loads all table data correctly. All of this data is via CDS entity where I define the metaPath in my XML fragment. Table renders, and data loads in just fine. 

Now, I would like to extend the functionality by adding a button ("Get Data") in the object page custom section, that when clicked, will load the data, and not when user opens the object page. Anybody have any examples of this I can potentially reference? 

Right now, my initial thoughts were using the pre-made controller JS extension file for my object page to try to not bind the data in the onInit() function? Then in my controller file for the XML fragment load the frag, and bind the data upon button click?

 
sap.ui.define(
[
    "sap/m/MessageToast",
    'sap/ui/model/Filter',
    'sap/ui/model/FilterOperator',
    'sap/ui/core/Fragment'

], function(MessageToast, Filter, FilterOperator, Fragment) {
    'use strict';
    return {
        onLoadData: async function (oEvent) {
                  ***load fragment -> find macros table ID -> bind elements via metapath to entity?***
        }
    };
});

__PRESENT

__PRESENT__PRESENT

entry.title: SAP BAS Analytic List Page Error "aggregate based entities"?
entry.content:
Hi, 

i am trying to make my first Analytic List Page. I made the CDS Views and the Odata V4 Service. Now i am in the BAS and trying to Use the Floorplan and make the App. 

I have problems at the Point "Entity Selection", I tried to add different Annotations, but i still get the error: 

"The OData V4 service you have provided is not suitable for use in an Analytical List Page application. The service must contain aggregate based entities for this template."

Can someone help me or knows what i have to change? Regards Niels

entry.title: How to Enable "Run as SAP Fiori Launchpad Sandbox" in SAP Business Application Studio?
entry.content: In SAP Web IDE, there was a convenient option called "Run as SAP Fiori Launchpad Sandbox" that allowed us to quickly test Fiori apps in a standalone sandbox environment. I'm currently using SAP Business Application Studio (BAS), and I can't find an equivalent feature.

entry.title: CDS watch fails in Business application studio.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am using BAS to create a CAPM application on Node.js. However, when I perform "cds watch", it gives following error. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
ERROR: Package '@sap/cds' was loaded from different installations: [
  '/home/user/projects/sample_app/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/index.js',
  '/extbin/globals/pnpm/5/.pnpm/@sap+cds@9.1.0_@eslint+js@9.30.1_express@4.21.2/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/index.js'
] 
Ensure a single install to avoid hard-to-resolve errors.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

My package.json looks as follows

{
  "name": "Sample_App",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A simple CAP project.",
  "repository": "<Add your repository here>",
  "license": "UNLICENSED",
  "private": true,
  "devDependencies": {
    "@sap/ux-specification": "^1.120.8",
    "rimraf": "^5"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "cds-serve",
    "watch-reassure": "cds watch --open uimodule/webapp/index.html?sap-ui-xx-viewCache=false",
    "undeploy": "cf undeploy Sample_App --delete-services --delete-service-keys --delete-service-brokers",
    "build": "rimraf resources mta_archives && mbt build --mtar archive",
    "deploy": "cf deploy mta_archives/archive.mtar --retries 1"
  },
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "db": {
        "kind": "hana"
      },
      "uaa": {
        "kind": "xsuaa"
      },
      "[production]": {
        "db": {
          "kind": "hana-cloud"
        },
        "auth": {
          "kind": "xsuaa"
        },
        "approuter": {
          "kind": "cloudfoundry"
        }
      },
      "auth": {
        "kind": "xsuaa"
      }
    },
    "cov2ap": {
      "plugin": true,
      "path": "v2"
    },
    "hana": {
      "deploy-format": "hdbtable"
    }
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@cap-js-community/odata-v2-adapter": "^1.15.2",
    "@cap-js/hana": "^2",
    "@sap/cds": "^9",
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^9",
    "@sap/xssec": "^4",
    "express": "^4",
    "jwt-decode": "^4",
    "sap-cf-axios": "^1.0.2"
  }
}

 

cds -v gives

-js/asyncapi: 1.0.3
@cap-js/db-service: 2.2.0
@cap-js/hana: 2.1.1
@cap-js/openapi: 1.2.3
@sap/cds: 9.1.0
@sap/cds-compiler: 6.1.0
@sap/cds-dk: 9.1.1
@sap/cds-dk (global): 9.0.6
@sap/cds-fiori: 2.0.1
@sap/cds-mtxs: 3.1.0
Sample_App: 1.0.0
Node.js: v22.13.1

 

npm ls -g gives

/home/user/.node_modules_global/lib
└── (empty)

 

Have tried installing @SAP/cds@9.0.6 to no avail. Kindly guide.

 

Regards,

Akshay

SAP Business Application Studio SAP Cloud Application Programming Model Node.js

entry.title: Unable to Connect SAP Business Application Studio to Visual Studio Code
entry.content: I am encountering an issue when attempting to connect to SAP Business Application Studio from Visual Studio Code using the SAP Business Application Studio Toolkit extension. I'm receiving an error message stating, 'Error running command local-extension.login: Personal Access Token is required. This is likely caused by the extension that contributes local-extension.login.' Additionally, there's a 'Login time out in 60000 ms.' notification. I am unsure why this error is occurring and how to resolve it. Any guidance or solutions would be greatly appreciated. The system I use is Public Cloud.

entry.title: BAS dev space remains in status "Starting"
entry.content:
I am using a trial account with the dev space ID ws-zzx7z and BAS dev space remains in status "Starting". I cannot use the expert chat as it needs an available customer to create a ticket or to ask for support in a chat.

What can I do? I also tried to download the content of the non-working space - I got an error Could not download the dev space. Failed to reach the 'running' state after 240 seconds. 

I want to still have access to the dev space as I have a project there that I was working on. Because of not being able to run the dev space, I might miss the interval during which the account is still available. 

How do I get support on this?

entry.title: Enabaling/Disabling SAP Macros Table Action buttons with JS?
entry.content:
Hi all -wanted to know if its possible to control enabling/disabling a SAP Macros Table action on the front-end? I have a SAP UI5 application based on the Flexible Programming Model template. I have a task where when a user selects a table row, the action button should only enable when a specific table field is set to a certain value. 

Ex. When table field = 1 -> action1 button should be enabled. If table field is not 1, then action1 button is disabled. I know that the SAP macros XML attribute "enabled" can be set to false and true and I was hoping I can control that manually. 

I started the logic by grabbing the table controller "this.byId("table name") and can see the actions inside the object. I just was not sure if there were methods to retrieve the action objects? 

Update: I ended up solving this by creating a JSON model to bind to the "enable" property in the XML view of my macros action. I found a similar task here: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/enable-button-based-on-a-condition-sapui5/qaq-p/12606940

In my onInit() function I created a new JSON model -> set the action1 variable to false -> and then set the model "actionStatus"

onInit: function () {
PageController.prototype.onInit.apply(this, arguments); // needs to be called to properly initialize the page controller
const actionStatusModel = new sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel({
buttons: {
action1: false,
},
});
this.getView().setModel(actionStatusModel, "actionStatus");
},

In onAfterRendering function, I attach my function "buttonStatus" to the event handler "attachSelectionChange". This fires my buttonStatus function evertime I click on a table row in my list view. 

onAfterRendering: function () {
        const that = this;
        const oTable = that.byId("Table");
        if (oTable) {
          oTable.attachSelectionChange(this._buttonStatus.bind(this));
        }
      },

My buttonStatus function just grabs the table row data and checks for the value of the "status" field from the table. Depending on the value it will set the JSON model variable "action1" to true or leave it as false. We set the JSON model property. 

    _buttonStatus: async function (oEvent) {
        const oTable = this.byId("Table");
        const actionStatusModel = this.getView().getModel("actionStatus");

        const oSelectedData = await ActionHelper._getSelectedRowData(
          oTable
        );

        const statusField = oSelectedData.status;

        actionStatusModel.setProperty("/buttons", {
          action1: status === "0", //Enable if statusFIeld === 0, otherwise disable
        });
      },
 
Then in the XML view, we make sure that we bind the "enabled" property correctly. So now this will be set to either "true" or "false" depending on the outcome of buttonStatus function. 
<macros:Table class="table" id="Table" metaPath="@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem" filterBar="FilterBar" selectionMode="Single" />
 <macros:actions>
   <macroTable:Action id="action1" key="action" text="Test" press=".onTest" placement="After" requiresSelection="true" enabled="{actionStatus>/buttons/action1}" />
 </macros:actions>
<macros:Table/><span><br /><br /><br /><div> <p><span>__PRESENT</span></p><p><span>__PRESENT</span></p><p><span>__PRESENT</span></p></div></span>

__PRESENT

entry.title: BAS - Git Flow
entry.content:
Hi,

I want to know how to use Git-Flow in BAS.

We installed the add-on Git Flow.

Whne i opens my workspace, i have this essage.

When i run the command "gIt flow Init", i have the message :

git: 'flow' is not a git command. See 'git --help'.

How can i do to install git flow on BAS ?

Thanks a lot.

entry.title: SAPUI5 Localization with i18n in annotations.xml not working
entry.content:
Hello,

I try to override annotations coming from backend OData service for SmartTable Headers with a local annotation.xml.

The local annotations file has been created using the Service Modeler.

I added some Annotations to the file, but it always states "Text key is not available. 'i18n.properties' file is missing or not registered in 'manifest.json' fileannotation-service(missing-i18n-key)". The problem is in line 39 of annotations.xml with the key "IsAssigned".

i18n is defined in manifest.json and the key I want to use is defined in i18n.properties.

I attached the manifest.json, the i18n.properties and the annotations.xml, maybe someone here has a solution for my problem.

Thank you!

entry.title: UI Integration Card Error while accessing in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

I have developed a UI Imtegration Card in BAS (Using the template UI Integration Card and able to do the preview there as it is getting data from Odata Service. PFA the preview for same.

After adding that Card in the Build Work Zone, Standard Edition it is giving error below error:

Destination "ecqrtcard" could not be resolved.

No technical destination found. Content Channel ID: "ovps". Please contact your administrator.

PFA the error screen shot along with destination configuration.

 

In BAS preview it is working means it is getting data from odata using the destination but in build work zone it is giving destinaiton error.

 

Please suggest what can be the issue.

entry.title: How to Use NPM Modules Like crypto-js in SAPUI5 Using UI5 Tooling Modules
entry.content:
Use NPM Modules in SAPUI5 on Cloud Foundry with UI5 Tooling (crypto-js Example)

Ever wanted to use modern JavaScript libraries like crypto-js in your SAPUI5 project? You're in the right place.

With the help of ui5-tooling-modules, you can now seamlessly integrate NPM modules into your UI5 apps—no hacks or copy-pasting needed.

Let’s unlock powerful encryption, hashing, and token generation in a few simple steps! 🚀

Note: This method is designed for use inside controller files (or any AMD-style module). You cannot use require() or top-level import syntax like in standard Node.js or modern frontend frameworks.

Prerequisites

  • Node.js installed

  • SAPUI5/Fiori Tools CLI
  • UI5 Tooling v3

    Step 1: Create a Basic SAPUI5 Project

    Use the SAP Fiori Tools or Yeoman generator.

    • Template: Basic

    • Data Source: None
    • Attributes: Default

      Ensure index.html looks something like this:

       <script
                   id="sap-ui-bootstrap"
                  src="resources/sap-ui-core.js"
                  data-sap-ui-theme="sap_horizon"
                  data-sap-ui-resourceroots='{ "your.project.namespace":               "./" }'
                  data-sap-ui-         oninit="module:sap/ui/core/ComponentSupport"

                 data-sap-ui-async="true" data-sap-ui- frameOptions="trusted" /> 

       

      Step 2: Install ui5-tooling-modules

      In your project root:


      npm install --save-dev ui5-tooling-modules

      ✅UI5  Tooling v3 handles module resolution—no need to add ui5.dependencies manually.

    • 🔒Step 3: Install crypto-js


      npm install --save-dev crypto-js

    • Step 4: Use crypto-js in Your Controller

      You can now use the npm module in any controller like this: 

       

      sap.ui.define([
      "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller",
      "crypto-js/sha256"
      ], function(Controller, SHA256) {
      "use strict";
      return Controller.extend("your.project.namespace.controller.Main", { onInit: function () {
      var message = "Hello UI5!";
      var hash = SHA256(message).toString();
      console.log("SHA256 Hash:", hash);
               }
          });
      });
      Reminder: This pattern only works inside controllers or AMD modules. You cannot use npm modules globally in your app or with require() outside of SAPUI5’s module system.

      Step 5: Configure ui5.yaml

      builder:
            customTasks:
                        - name: ui5-tooling-modules-task
                           afterTask: replaceVersion
      server:
             customMiddleware:
                 - name: ui5-tooling-modules-middleware                                             afterMiddleware: compression
                  - name: fiori-tools-proxy
                   afterMiddleware: ui5-tooling-modules-middleware

    • Step 6: Run and Test

      Start the app using:

      npm run start-noflp

      Open DevTools → Console. You should see the SHA256 hash logged.

       

      Why Use crypto-js in SAPUI5?

      • Modern encryption, hashing, and token generation

      • No external script tags or CDNs
      • Works natively with AMD modules in SAPUI5
      • TypeScript-friendly
      • Perfect for using NPM modules inside controllers

        Final Thoughts

        Thanks to ui5-tooling-modules, integrating npm packages like crypto-js is clean and stable. While it’s limited to controller (or AMD module) scope, that’s often enough for most enterprise UI logic.
        Whether you’re building internal tools or customer apps, this setup empowers you to use modern JS libraries safely within the SAPUI5 ecosystem.
